properties.areaDesc: Haskell, OK; Cherokee, OK; Sequoyah, OK; Le Flore, OK; Adair, OK
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 10 at 3:55PM CST until January 10 at 4:45PM CST by NWS Tulsa OK
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
Northeastern Haskell County in southeastern Oklahoma...
Sequoyah County in east central Oklahoma...
Adair County in northeastern Oklahoma...
Northern Le Flore County in southeastern Oklahoma...
Southeastern Cherokee County in east central Oklahoma...

* Until 445 PM CST.

* At 354 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from 3 miles northwest of Cookson to 3 miles north of
Keota, moving northeast at 55 mph.

HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable
tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes,
roofs, and outbuildings.

* Locations in or near the path include...
Sallisaw...                       Stilwell...
Muldrow...                        Roland...
Arkoma...                         Westville...
Vian...                           Keota...
Gans...                           Marble City...
Tamaha...                         Moffett...
Brushy...                         Adair State Park...
Christie...                       Maryetta...
Cookson...                        Brushy Lake State Park...
Cherokee Landing State Park...    Bunch...

This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 292 and
328.
properties.instruction:
Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly
from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the
basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.
